parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From pros and echo; to hold the mind towards, i.e. Pay attention to, be cautious about, apply oneself to, adhere to.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: Himself, herself, itself.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A little flock. Neuter of a presumed derivative of poimne; a flock, i.e. group.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
Wind, breath, spirit.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To put, place, lay, set, fix, establish. A prolonged form of a primary theo to place.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From epi and skopos; a superintendent, i.e. Christian officer in genitive case charge of a church.
To shepherd, tend, herd; hence: I rule, govern. From poimen; to tend as a shepherd of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of ek and a derivative of kaleo; a calling out, i.e. a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To acquire, earn, purchase, make my own, preserve alive.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
Blood, literally, figuratively or specially; by implication, bloodshed, also kindred.
